TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CosmosClientOptions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines all the configurable options that the CosmosClient requires.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new CosmosClientOptions

MemberSignature.Value: member this.AllowBulkExecution : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Allows optimistic batching of requests to service. Setting this option might impact the latency of the operations. Hence this option is recommended for non-latency sensitive scenarios only.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ApplicationName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Get or set user-agent suffix to include with every Azure Cosmos DB service interaction.
Docs.remarks: Setting this property after sending any request won't have any effect.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ApplicationPreferredRegions As IReadOnlyList(Of String)

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the preferred regions for geo-replicated database accounts in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

remarks.para: During the CosmosClient initialization the account information, including the available regions, is obtained from the . The CosmosClient will use the value of to populate the preferred list with the account available regions that intersect with its value. If the value of contains regions that are not an available region in the account, the values will be ignored. If the these invalid regions are added later to the account, the CosmosClient will use them if they are higher in the preference order.

If during CosmosClient initialization, the is not reachable, the CosmosClient will attempt to recover and obtain the account information issuing requests to the regions in in the order that they are listed.
See also Diagnose and troubleshoot the availability of Cosmos SDKs for more details.
This configuration is an alternative to , either one can be set but not both.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ApplicationRegion : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the location where the application is running. This will influence the SDK's choice for the Azure Cosmos DB service interaction.

remarks.para: During the CosmosClient initialization the account information, including the available regions, is obtained from the . The CosmosClient will use the value of to populate the preferred list with the account available regions ordered by geographical proximity to the indicated region. If the value of is not an available region in the account, the preferred list is still populated following the same mechanism but would not include the indicated region.

If during CosmosClient initialization, the is not reachable, the CosmosClient will attempt to recover and obtain the account information issuing requests to all ordered by proximity to the . For more granular control over the selected regions or to define a list based on a custom criteria, use instead of .
See also Diagnose and troubleshoot the availability of Cosmos SDKs for more details.
This configuration is an alternative to , either one can be set but not both.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ConnectionMode : Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.ConnectionMode with get, set

Docs.summary: Get or set the connection mode used by the client when connecting to the Azure Cosmos DB service.
Docs.remarks: For more information, see Connection policy: Use direct connection mode.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ConsistencyLevel As Nullable(Of ConsistencyLevel)

Docs.summary: This can be used to weaken the database account consistency level for read operations. If this is not set the database account consistency level will be used for all requests.
Gets or sets Client Telemetry Options like feature flags and corresponding options

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CustomHandlers As Collection(Of RequestHandler)

Docs.summary: Gets the handlers run before the process

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property EnableContentResponseOnWrite As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.EnableContentResponseOnWrite : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the boolean to only return the headers and status code in the Cosmos DB response for write item operation like Create, Upsert, Patch and Replace. Setting the option to false will cause the response to have a null resource. This reduces networking and CPU load by not sending the resource back over the network and serializing it on the client.

remarks.para: This is optimal for workloads where the returned resource is not used.
This option can be overriden by similar property in ItemRequestOptions and TransactionalBatchItemRequestOptions

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the flag to enable address cache refresh on TCP connection reset notification.
Docs.remarks: Does not apply if is used.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.GatewayModeMaxConnectionLimit : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Get or set the maximum number of concurrent connections allowed for the target service endpoint in the Azure Cosmos DB service.
Docs.remarks: This setting is only applicable in Gateway mode.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property HttpClientFactory As Func(Of HttpClient)
member this.HttpClientFactory : Func<System.Net.Http.HttpClient> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a delegate to use to obtain an HttpClient instance to be used for HTTPS communication.

remarks.para: HTTPS communication is used when is set to for all operations and when is (default) for metadata operations.
Useful in scenarios where the application is using a pool of HttpClient instances to be shared, like ASP.NET Core applications with IHttpClientFactory or Blazor WebAssembly applications.
For .NET core applications the default GatewayConnectionLimit will be ignored. It must be set on the HttpClientHandler.MaxConnectionsPerServer to limit the number of connections

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property IdleTcpConnectionTimeout As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.IdleTcpConnectionTimeout : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: (Direct/TCP) Controls the amount of idle time after which unused connections are closed.
Docs.value: By default, idle connections are kept open indefinitely. Value must be greater than or equal to 10 minutes. Recommended values are between 20 minutes and 24 hours.
Docs.remarks: Mainly useful for sparse infrequent access to a large database account.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.LimitToEndpoint : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Limits the operations to the provided endpoint on the CosmosClient.
Docs.remarks: When the value of this property is false, the SDK will automatically discover write and read regions, and use them when the configured application region is not available. When set to true, availability is limited to the endpoint specified on the CosmosClient constructor. Defining the or is not allowed when setting the value to true.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxRequestsPerTcpConnection As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxRequestsPerTcpConnection : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: (Direct/TCP) Controls the number of requests allowed simultaneously over a single TCP connection. When more requests are in flight simultaneously, the direct/TCP client will open additional connections.
Docs.value: The default settings allow 30 simultaneous requests per connection. Do not set this value lower than 4 requests per connection or higher than 50-100 requests per connection. The former can lead to a large number of connections to be created. The latter can lead to head of line blocking, high latency and timeouts.
Docs.remarks: Applications with a very high degree of parallelism per connection, with large requests or responses, or with very tight latency requirements might get better performance with 8-16 requests per connection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxRetryAttemptsOnRateLimitedRequests As Nullable(Of Integer)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of retries in the case where the request fails because the Azure Cosmos DB service has applied rate limiting on the client.
Docs.value:
The default value is 9. This means in the case where the request is rate limited, the same request will be issued for a maximum of 10 times to the server before an error is returned to the application.
If the value of this property is set to 0, there will be no automatic retry on rate limiting requests from the client and the exception needs to be handled at the application level.

remarks.para: When a client is sending requests faster than the allowed rate, the service will return HttpStatusCode 429 (Too Many Requests) to rate limit the client. The current implementation in the SDK will then wait for the amount of time the service tells it to wait and retry after the time has elapsed.
For more information, see Handle rate limiting/request rate too large.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxRetryWaitTimeOnRateLimitedRequests As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum retry time in seconds for the Azure Cosmos DB service.

remarks.para: The minimum interval is seconds. Any interval that is smaller will be ignored.

When a request fails due to a rate limiting error, the service sends back a response that contains a value indicating the client should not retry before the time period has elapsed.
This property allows the application to set a maximum wait time for all retry attempts. If the cumulative wait time exceeds the this value, the client will stop retrying and return the error to the application.
For more information, see Handle rate limiting/request rate too large.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxTcpConnectionsPerEndpoint As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxTcpConnectionsPerEndpoint : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: (Direct/TCP) Controls the maximum number of TCP connections that may be opened to each Cosmos DB back-end. Together with MaxRequestsPerTcpConnection, this setting limits the number of requests that are simultaneously sent to a single Cosmos DB back-end(MaxRequestsPerTcpConnection x MaxTcpConnectionPerEndpoint).
Docs.value: The default value is 65,535. Value must be greater than or equal to 16.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property OpenTcpConnectionTimeout As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.OpenTcpConnectionTimeout : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: (Direct/TCP) Controls the amount of time allowed for trying to establish a connection.
Docs.value: The default timeout is 5 seconds. Recommended values are greater than or equal to 5 seconds.
Docs.remarks: When the time elapses, the attempt is cancelled and an error is returned. Longer timeouts will delay retries and failures.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property PortReuseMode As Nullable(Of PortReuseMode)

Docs.summary: (Direct/TCP) Controls the client port reuse policy used by the transport stack.
Docs.remarks: ReuseUnicastPort and PrivatePortPool are not mutually exclusive. When PrivatePortPool is enabled, the client first tries to reuse a port it already has. It falls back to allocating a new port if the initial attempts failed. If this fails, too, the client then falls back to ReuseUnicastPort.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.RequestTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets the request timeout in seconds when connecting to the Azure Cosmos DB service. The number specifies the time to wait for response to come back from network peer.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Serializer : Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosSerializer with get, set

Docs.summary: Get to set an optional JSON serializer. The client will use it to serialize or de-serialize user's cosmos request/responses. SDK owned types such as DatabaseProperties and ContainerProperties will always use the SDK default serializer.
Get to set optional serializer options.

MemberSignature.Value: .property instance class System.Func`4<class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2, class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain, valuetype System.Net.Security.SslPolicyErrors, bool> ServerCertificateCustomValidationCallback
Public Property ServerCertificateCustomValidationCallback As Func(Of X509Certificate2, X509Chain, SslPolicyErrors, Boolean)

member this.ServerCertificateCustomValidationCallback : Func<System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain, System.Net.Security.SslPolicyErrors, bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: A callback delegate to do custom certificate validation for both HTTP and TCP.

remarks.para: Customizing SSL verification is not recommended in production environments.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TokenCredentialBackgroundRefreshInterval As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

Docs.summary: The SDK does a background refresh based on the time interval set to refresh the token credentials. This avoids latency issues because the old token is used until the new token is retrieved.
Docs.remarks: The recommended minimum value is 5 minutes. The default value is 50% of the token expire time.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.WebProxy : System.Net.IWebProxy with get, set

Docs.summary: (Gateway/Https) Get or set the proxy information used for web requests.
